page.title: 01GENERAL VIEW OF 12Km block
page.content: Our area is mainly farmland,either crops such as wheat, barley, sugar beet, potatoes and rape, or grass left to be cut as silage and hay. Some is used as grazing land as well. A lot of the farmland is privately owned, with companies such as GALLIFORD LTD and COVENTRY CO-OPERATIVE SOCIETY taking parts of it. It contains the small village of BURTON HASTINGS as well as other houses scatterd over the farmland. The M69 motorway,which joins the M1 and M6, runs through our area. It comes from COVENTRY to LEICESTER. The only church is St.Botolph's in Burton Hastings.A large area is taken up with BRAMCOTE BARRACKS which covers just over 1SqKm. The Ashby de la Zouch canal runs through part of the area. It has 6 bridges passing over it. .
